snippet: The remains of Albert DeSalvo, the man suspected of being the Boston Strangler, were exhumed Friday so a medical examiner may take tissue or bone samples.
abstract: Remains of Albert DeSalvo, man suspected of being the Boston Strangler, are exhumed so a medical examiner may take tissue or bone samples; investigators seek to tie DeSalvo to 1964 death of Mary Sullivan, possibly the Strangler's last victim.
lead_paragraph: The remains of Albert DeSalvo, the man suspected of being the Boston Strangler, were exhumed Friday so a medical examiner may take tissue or bone samples.
